answers.answer: Well,  it's good that it's been diagnosed,  and at 32 weeks even if you were to deliver now,  you can expect a great outcome for your baby.Best wishes.
Thank you. <3 I just feel terrible cause it's MY body that is not cooperating.
Just be happy that your body is able to carry a baby!
Trust, me I am. I've been through a miscarriage and don't wish anything like that upon ANYONE. Like I said, I feel terrible because it's MY body that is messing up and making it dangerous for Baby.

Hun do not feel bad at all its not ur fault the good thing it was diagnosed early and at 32 weeks child has acgreat chance of survival i.was a premie so we're all three my brothers were all healthy and alive and im so sorry about ur miscarriage losing ur baby is so hard but God did bless u with a beautiful baby and may ur condition not over power your pregnancy.

I had preclampsia I was diagnosed very earlier I was in the hospitals 3 weeks got out for almost a month an was put back in and delivered a day later at 36 weeks because myblood ppressure was 190/105 some where around there and my daughter came out fine although I was on magnesium sulfate so they keep you like a day longer to make sher your bp goes down an the meds were off

Thank you for the support ladies. <3 I greatly appreciate it. I just want what's best for my little girl and want her to stay in as long as possible. My sister in law had Pre E as well but she was already 36 weeks. 32 weeks just seemed so scary and early to me.

That's a really good question,  mimi,  and I don't think there's an answer for it.  Preeclampsia happens to mothers who take excellent care of themselves,  and mothers who don't - it just seems random.

It's where the mothers body is not absorbing enough nutrients for her and baby, so baby is getting everything leaving the mom lacking. Which makes our bodies (specifically liver and kidneys) work harder to produce blood which makes the symptoms of high BP and protein in urine. Our bodies become "toxic" in a way which is why the old word for it is toxemia. My mom's midwife filled me on cause I had no idea what it was. And like you said, you can have it one pregnancy and not the other. I'm normally very healthy and have gained 31 lbs so far but my body doesn't seem to be working.

question: *sigh* I officially have been diagnosed with Pre eclampsia. :/ I'm only 32 weeks. I will be monitored very very closely due to the fact that I am not considered severe yet. Our goal is to get me to 37 weeks.
title: Pre eclampsia
